intro: Galium megacyttarion var. megacyttarion, commonly known as the dwarf bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features slender, prostrate stems that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. This species thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
